channel.title: 30 Useful Team Build Properties
channel.description: If you are going to get into the Zen of TFS Team Build, then at some point you are going to have to read the TeamBuild .targets file (located in %ProgramFiles%\MSBuild\Microsoft\VisualStudio\TeamBuild\Microsoft.TeamFoundation.Build.targets).  The TeamBuild build scripts are usually extensions of this master build...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Sudheer+00:00
item.description: But remember, you cannot get the value of the "RequestedBy" in the MSBuild Script. Looks like you need to write a custom task : See: http://blogs.msdn.com/gautamg/archive/2005/12/20/505863.aspx
item.dc:creator: Sudheer

item.title: Comment by Martin+00:00
item.description:
Sudheer,
RequestedBy and RequestedFor are available inside the Team Build 2008 build scripts, so with TFS2008 you won't need that workaround.
Cheers,
Martin.
item.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Greg+00:00
item.description:
Thanks for posting this. Its very useful!
Cheers Greg
item.dc:creator: Greg

item.title: Comment by John+00:00
item.description: RequestedFor can't be overridden right? It's only there to query against?
item.dc:creator: John

item.title: Comment by Reza+00:00
item.description: thanks for this post. Relly useful!!!!
item.dc:creator: Reza

item.title: Comment by Rob Burke+00:00
item.description: I've been knee-deep in TFS and MSBuild for the past couple of weeks, and Google keeps sending me back to your blog, where I am consistently delivered the tidbits and top tips I'm after. I really appreciate all the effort you've put into this site over the years and - as if it were ever in doubt - it's crystal clear why you are held in such high regard by the community. Thank you Martin!!
item.dc:creator: Rob Burke
